channel.title: Guess Jagex's future updates!
channel.description:
I wonder how Jagex will ruin runescape further. I'm guessing they will probably do something retarded like remove some F2P skills, or start adding more new oped weapons.
Discuss.

item.title: Guess Jagex's future updates!
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“r0ckstar96, post:38, topic:424164”]They should let you choose what revision you’d like to play on out of the given options (i.e. 317, 377, 474, 508, etc.)
I wanna go back to when they had the amazingly terrible graphics. The crumpled paper looking thing for the chatbox area, dirt blocks for buttons, and all that jazz. Damn good times…[/quote]

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

item.title: Guess Jagex's future updates!
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:36, topic:424164”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=526820.msg3839322#msg3839322 date=1323123823]

fuck this game.
I miss my Runescape.

Oh Jesus, if they add that revision of runescape right next to the RSC revision on the website, I’ll buy endless membership so they can continue hosting them without running out of money. I don’t mind starting from level 3.

I would do that. Starting from level 3 would be better, in fact.

I wish runescape could start over. I always try to look for RPGs like that, hoping they’ll become big and my name can be a part in the game. It never turns out though, most of them die or stay on the unpopular side.

I like to join things right when they start, even if they suck, just so when and if they do become big, I can be like “I’m a founding member!”
[/quote]

Back when I used to play adventure quest (lol), they released a multiplayer version of the game. My account got banned, but I have the 2nd rarest item ingame that was only available during the short beta period. The account averages like 30k people on at a time (only half of runescape now), but my parents got the account banned during a payment dispute when they thought the game was charging them more money then it did. Ah well…[/quote]
I have an account from the beta days back then that has a subscription laying dormant.

Read full topic

item.title: Guess Jagex's future updates!
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“imsuperman05, post:30, topic:424164”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=526820.msg3839102#msg3839102 date=1323116898]

http://services.runescape.com/m=news/behind-the-scenes---december-3

[quote]We will be releasing a batch of projects this month that will hopefully relieve a few irritations you may have experienced. These are the first of many upgrades and improvements to reduce the number of ‘clicks’ you perform in RuneScape, so expect more to come.

Conversation Update

We are upgrading the main chat panels you see when interacting with NPCs. We’ve gone for a modern, fresher look, while still retaining something unique and fitting for RuneScape. These upgrades are not just graphical: you’ll be able to use number keys to select from multiple chat options AND press the space bar instead of ’Click to continue‘. You can even hold down the space bar to fast-track through conversations.

Toolbelt

On release, you’ll notice a brand new button, accessed via the worn inventory screen. This is the toolbelt, and it will act like a new equip ’slot‘ that can carry all of your basic tools: from farming implements to tinderboxes. The toolbelt has no prerequisites and won’t occupy any inventory or worn slots. Using it couldn’t be simpler, as all resources can now be single-clicked, meaning you won’t need to withdraw a tool in order to use it.

Money Pouch

At its core, the money pouch is like an additional and free inventory slot for coins. You can use your pouch to store up to 2.1 billion GP and, in MOST situations, coins picked up are added directly to your money pouch. All financial interactions are now handled directly by the pouch, so you won’t need to withdraw cash into your inventory to use it (although you still can, if you wish). As was true before this update, coins are safe from being dropped on death unless they are in your inventory when you die in the Wilderness.

I cant wait. so long over due.
[/quote]
coffall from private servers and directed towards the richest players, not helping the noobscoff
I read that they plan on changing the Iron and Bronze armor, I will hate them if they do.
[/quote]
They plan to change every armour. Watch the video.[/quote]
fuck this game.
I miss my Runescape.

Read full topic

item.title: Guess Jagex's future updates!
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:29, topic:424164”][quote author=xryz link=topic=526820.msg3838963#msg3838963 date=1323104882]

RuneScape

Behind the scenes - December

Seasonal greetings to you all! Yet more fantastic updates in store for this month with a new desert village, expansion to the Champions� Guild, new farming leprechauns, wyverns, festive imps, a devious quest, choc ices, a new piece of granite...

[quote]We will be releasing a batch of projects this month that will hopefully relieve a few irritations you may have experienced. These are the first of many upgrades and improvements to reduce the number of ‘clicks’ you perform in RuneScape, so expect more to come.

Conversation Update

We are upgrading the main chat panels you see when interacting with NPCs. We’ve gone for a modern, fresher look, while still retaining something unique and fitting for RuneScape. These upgrades are not just graphical: you’ll be able to use number keys to select from multiple chat options AND press the space bar instead of ’Click to continue‘. You can even hold down the space bar to fast-track through conversations.

Toolbelt

On release, you’ll notice a brand new button, accessed via the worn inventory screen. This is the toolbelt, and it will act like a new equip ’slot‘ that can carry all of your basic tools: from farming implements to tinderboxes. The toolbelt has no prerequisites and won’t occupy any inventory or worn slots. Using it couldn’t be simpler, as all resources can now be single-clicked, meaning you won’t need to withdraw a tool in order to use it.

Money Pouch

At its core, the money pouch is like an additional and free inventory slot for coins. You can use your pouch to store up to 2.1 billion GP and, in MOST situations, coins picked up are added directly to your money pouch. All financial interactions are now handled directly by the pouch, so you won’t need to withdraw cash into your inventory to use it (although you still can, if you wish). As was true before this update, coins are safe from being dropped on death unless they are in your inventory when you die in the Wilderness.
[/quote]
I cant wait. so long over due.
[/quote]
coffall from private servers and directed towards the richest players, not helping the noobscoff
I read that they plan on changing the Iron and Bronze armor, I will hate them if they do.[/quote]
They plan to change every armour. Watch the video.

Read full topic

[quote]We will be releasing a batch of projects this month that will hopefully relieve a few irritations you may have experienced. These are the first of many upgrades and improvements to reduce the number of ‘clicks’ you perform in RuneScape, so expect more to come.

Conversation Update

We are upgrading the main chat panels you see when interacting with NPCs. We’ve gone for a modern, fresher look, while still retaining something unique and fitting for RuneScape. These upgrades are not just graphical: you’ll be able to use number keys to select from multiple chat options AND press the space bar instead of ’Click to continue‘. You can even hold down the space bar to fast-track through conversations.

Toolbelt

On release, you’ll notice a brand new button, accessed via the worn inventory screen. This is the toolbelt, and it will act like a new equip ’slot‘ that can carry all of your basic tools: from farming implements to tinderboxes. The toolbelt has no prerequisites and won’t occupy any inventory or worn slots. Using it couldn’t be simpler, as all resources can now be single-clicked, meaning you won’t need to withdraw a tool in order to use it.

Money Pouch

At its core, the money pouch is like an additional and free inventory slot for coins. You can use your pouch to store up to 2.1 billion GP and, in MOST situations, coins picked up are added directly to your money pouch. All financial interactions are now handled directly by the pouch, so you won’t need to withdraw cash into your inventory to use it (although you still can, if you wish). As was true before this update, coins are safe from being dropped on death unless they are in your inventory when you die in the Wilderness.
[/quote]
I cant wait. so long over due.[/quote]

item.title: Guess Jagex's future updates!
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

RuneScape

Behind the scenes - December

Seasonal greetings to you all! Yet more fantastic updates in store for this month with a new desert village, expansion to the Champions� Guild, new farming leprechauns, wyverns, festive imps, a devious quest, choc ices, a new piece of granite...

We will be releasing a batch of projects this month that will hopefully relieve a few irritations you may have experienced. These are the first of many upgrades and improvements to reduce the number of ‘clicks’ you perform in RuneScape, so expect more to come.

Conversation Update

We are upgrading the main chat panels you see when interacting with NPCs. We’ve gone for a modern, fresher look, while still retaining something unique and fitting for RuneScape. These upgrades are not just graphical: you’ll be able to use number keys to select from multiple chat options AND press the space bar instead of ’Click to continue‘. You can even hold down the space bar to fast-track through conversations.

Toolbelt

On release, you’ll notice a brand new button, accessed via the worn inventory screen. This is the toolbelt, and it will act like a new equip ’slot‘ that can carry all of your basic tools: from farming implements to tinderboxes. The toolbelt has no prerequisites and won’t occupy any inventory or worn slots. Using it couldn’t be simpler, as all resources can now be single-clicked, meaning you won’t need to withdraw a tool in order to use it.

Money Pouch

At its core, the money pouch is like an additional and free inventory slot for coins. You can use your pouch to store up to 2.1 billion GP and, in MOST situations, coins picked up are added directly to your money pouch. All financial interactions are now handled directly by the pouch, so you won’t need to withdraw cash into your inventory to use it (although you still can, if you wish). As was true before this update, coins are safe from being dropped on death unless they are in your inventory when you die in the Wilderness.


I cant wait. so long over due.

Read full topic

item.title: Guess Jagex's future updates!
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“Wet Dreamss, post:25, topic:424164”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=526820.msg3838863#msg3838863 date=1323089020]

They should add like certain classes for Pvp. or Pvm. Like if u enter GWD you have to pick a class like Mage range, melee. and work your way up to better equipment while your in there. Same with Pvp except you get a basic set until you get kills?
That’d be cool. lol
[/quote]You mean dungeoneering…?

No, like when you cross Wildy ditch, an interface pops up saying “Warrior, Magician, Ranger” Then you pick one, and it sets u up with basic equipment, and the more kills you get the better equipment you get. But the only flaw is that noobs would be getting ass fucked.[/quote]

Solution for the noobs: Jagex adds Pain Killer after a certain amount of deaths in a row.
